title: Valves and Valve Stem Seals - Installation

body.body: Valves and Valve Stem Seals - Installation
Lubricate the valve stems with new engine oil which meets specification API SH (or higher) and JASO MA.
Install the valve into the valve guide.
During installation of the valve stem seal, you will feel two distinctly different degrees of resistance when the seal is correctly fitted.

Firstly, press the seal down the valve stem until the lower side of the seal comes into contact with the valve guide. Greater resistance is felt at this contact point and further gentle pressure is then needed to locate the seal over the top end of the valve guide.
On application of this pressure, the seal can be felt to positively locate over the top face of the valve guide. When correctly positioned, you cannot push the seal down further.
Incorrect installation of the valve stem oil seals can cause high oil consumption and blue smoke emissions from the exhaust system.
Do not use excessive force when installing the seal as this can break the seal ring.
Fit the valve stem seal over the valve stem and, using a suitable tool, press down fully until the seal is correctly seated over the valve guide.
Install the valve spring over the valve stem. Make sure that the close wound, colour coded ends of the springs are fitted downwards (towards the piston).

body.body: Compress the valve spring. Make sure that the spring is compressed squarely to prevent damage to the valve stem and cylinder head.
Always check for correct location of the valve collets during and after assembly.
If not installed correctly, the collets may become dislodged when the engine is running.
This can cause the valves to contact the pistons.
Valve to piston contact will cause severe engine damage.
Fit the valve collets. Make sure the collets are correctly located in the spring retainer and valve as the spring compressor is released.
